intro: Thyrsanthus aubletianus, commonly known as the golden thorn, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, characterized by its dense, thorny stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by bright red berries that are edible for birds. Its botanical features include hairy stems, glandular leaves, and a unique reproductive system involving both self- and cross-pollination. Thyrsanthus aubletianus plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
